research_context: The study focuses on idiopathic dilated cardiomyopathy (DCM), a significant cause of heart failure and heart transplantation. Left ventricular reverse remodeling (LVRR) is an important factor in reducing mortality and improving cardiac function in DCM.
motivation: Despite improvements in heart failure treatment, LVRR occurs in only a proportion of DCM patients. Early identification of patients likely to undergo LVRR could improve patient management and therapeutic strategies.
problem_statement: There is a lack of early prediction models for LVRR in patients with first-diagnosed idiopathic dilated cardiomyopathy, leading to challenges in prognostic stratification and management of the condition.

additional_details.study_design: The study is a single-center retrospective analysis involving 104 patients with idiopathic DCM.
additional_details.objectives: The objective is to develop and compare the performance of a linear model, random forest, and extreme gradient boosting (XGBoost) for early prediction of LVRR.
